ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to view a painting, visual analysis skills, history of art work
Skills to basically analyze and learn from an artwork, in addition, the ability to understand the background and meaning of an artwork.
Visual analysis, writing, secondary source analysis
I learned a lot of invaluable historical context and terminology to better understand trends in art and to better communicate the qualities of a particular piece of art.
Visual Analysis, Critical Analysis, Knowledge of historial contexts
I developed my visual analysis skills, essay writing skills, and research skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really like the course - nothing to improve. the 3 hour lectures were split very well to keep everyone engaged
The lectures were long and not as engaging as I thought they could be.

The strengths were excellent teaching, feedback, and well-rounded sources used to build our understanding of the material, the weaknesses were out of the instructors' control - I would have preferred to see some art pieces in person - but that does not negate how much I really enjoyed this class.
The class discussion and sharing by multiple people about the visual analysis of the artworks rather than just the reading.
The classes were too long, if they were spread out over multiple days, instead of two, I would have been better able to concentrate.
Pros: Really great and clear lectures, Engaging with social and historical context of art

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes - this is a great intro to art history with a good balance of work and learning.
Yes, it is very helpful and insightful to students who are interested in Art History.
Probably not. I learned some interesting things, but things I probably could've learned elsewhere.

I would 100% recommend this class to a student who wants to have a general, well-rounded idea of how art has developed from the Renaissance until now, and who want to develop their visual analysis skills.
Yes. The course was interesting providing both specific knowledge of artworks and art movements and broader historical context
Yes, great course

comments: Agree
